text: Hello everyone. I welcome you to the Faculty of Orléans,
a place where imagination meets logic and where every bug is an opportunity for creativity.
This year, as every year, we will explore fascinating territories
: from artificial intelligence to distributed systems, web development to quantum architectures still somewhat mysterious.
But beyond languages and frameworks, what we seek to transmit to you is critical thinking, curiosity, and the ability to solve problems... even those that seem impossible at first. Thank you.
I am your formal calculus professor, Antoine Robert. Before, I was like you
a student of this faculty, sitting in the same seats as you. By listening to lectures and working well
I managed to get this professor position. I am now a teacher-researcher, which consists of -...

text: Protagonist (Internally): I expected it a little... but it still hurts. I wanted to do better. I wanted to prove that I could handle classes and work at the same time, but I couldn't.

All those nights coming home late from work... Falling asleep on my lessons... Putting off my revisions because I was too exhausted to think. It was too much for me, I thought I could hold on, that it would be fine, that it was normal to be tired, but my mind was elsewhere in class, I couldn't follow anymore.
I feel like I did everything I could, and yet it wasn't enough.

text: Protagonist (Internally): Refused... I thought it would be a shock... but effectively, it's mostly a funny mix. Surprise... and at the same time, not really.

In high school, I was good. Really good. Everyone told me I had potential, that I was 'made for studies'. Yet I completely dropped out. The truth... is that it didn't interest me. I tried to convince myself, I followed the path everyone expected of me but every class seemed... empty.

Far from what I really wanted to do. And inevitably, by dint of not being motivated... I gave nothing. I did the minimum, sometimes nothing at all. How could I have succeeded like that? It wasn't for me. And I realize it only now, too late.
